citeinfo.origin: Mark Halverson, Rich Pawlowicz, and Randall Lee of University of British Columbia, Department of Earth and Ocean Sciences
citeinfo.title: Strait of Georgia Ferry Data by STRATOGEM: Tsawwassen/Duke Point, Canada

abstract.p: The STRATOGEM program instrumented a BC Ferry traveling regularly between Tsawwassen/Duke Point. The ferry track runs across the large Fraser river and into the clearer water of the north, allowing an assessment of the influence that plume dynamics have within this ecosystem. The ferry, equipped with a thermosalinograph, chlorophyll fluorometer, data logger, and, intermittently, an ultra-violet spectrophotometric nitrate sensor, may sample up to eight times per day, record position and water property data at 2 - 10 second intervals. This ferry route has been in operation since 13 January 2003.
Data sets are provided online at http://www.stratogem.ubc.ca/BCFerry/Central/.

descript.purpose: To define the effects of tidal, diurnal, weatherband, seasonal, and climatic influences in the production surface layer of Strait of Georgia.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
